title: 20 Years After Landing: How NASA's Twin Rovers Changed Mars Science
summary: This month marks the 20th anniversary of Spirit and Opportunity’s landing on Mars, part of a mission whose legacy will extend far into the future.

title: Astroscale reveals concept of operations for its in-orbit refueling vehicle
summary: Astroscale is developing an in-space refueling vehicle that will shuttle back and forth between a fuel depot in geostationary Earth orbit and a client satellite.

title: With access to space on the line, the U.S. is eating its seed corn
summary: Tim Kyger and Pat Bahn argue that the U.S. must continue to prioritize R&D for technology that secures its access to space.

title: Impulse Space announces plan to develop high-energy kick stage
summary: Impulse Space, which launched its first orbital transfer vehicle last year, has unveiled plans for a larger vehicle for transporting satellites to geostationary and other orbits.

title: New report calls for DoD investments in lunar space infrastructure
summary: The U.S. needs to flex its space muscles in the face of China's lunar ambitions, argues a new report from the Mitchell Institute for Aerospace Studies released Jan. 17.

title: Meet Helios, a new class of space tug with some real muscle
summary: "Just give us a sip. We'll take our 14 tons and we'll be glad to pay for it."

title: Axiom-3 ready to send a multinational crew to ISS
summary: The private Axiom-3 mission to the International Space Station is being readied for launch from LC-39A at the Kennedy Space Center. The mission features a crew representing five different countries, four of them wholly or partly in Europe.

title: Japan’s SLIM spacecraft lowers orbit ahead of Friday moon landing attempt
summary: Japan’s SLIM moon lander has entered a lower, near-circular lunar orbit ahead of its Jan. 19 landing attempt.

title: Daily Telescope: A beautiful supernova remnant from an uncertain age
summary: Sometimes astronomy can be a bit imprecise.

title: Third Axiom Space private astronaut mission ready for launch
summary: Axiom Space is set to launch its third private astronaut mission to the International Space Station, although technical issues have compressed the timeline for launch preparations.
